articles.author: Reuters Staff
articles.title: Richard Branson's Virgin Orbit seeks $1 billion valuation in funding round: WSJ - Reuters Africa
articles.description: Richard Branson's satellite-launch business Virgin Orbit is looking to raise up to $200 million in a funding round that could value it at around $1 billion, The Wall Street Journal reported on Sunday, citing people familiar with the matter.
articles.content:
By Reuters Staff

articles.author: Peter Roff
articles.title: What to Do About Columbus Day | Opinion
articles.description: Rather than abolish Columbus Day, let us add to its meaning. Let's make it the holiday that celebrates the accomplishments immigrants have made and continue to make for America and the world.
articles.content: America is a divided country. Some believe in its exceptionalism and that it has been and remains a force for global good. Others think a political and cultural overhaul that rejects our founding pri… [+4567 chars]

articles.author: Shawn Tully
articles.title: The next President will hold a lot of sway over Tesla’s biggest profit center
articles.description: But even an environmentalist in the White House will only buy Tesla some time, rather than preserve its current flood of profits.

articles.author: Andy Greenberg
articles.title: Split-Second ‘Phantom’ Images Can Fool Tesla’s Autopilot
articles.description: Researchers found they could stop a Tesla by flashing a few frames of a stop sign for less than half a second on an internet-connected billboard.
articles.content: Safety concerns over automated driver-assistance systems like Tesla's usually focus on what the car can't see, like the white side of a truck that one Tesla confused with a bright sky in 2016, leadin… [+4485 chars]

articles.title: LG Chem says second-quarter operating profit likely jumped 159%
articles.description: LG Chem Ltd <051910.KS>, an electric vehicle (EV) battery supplier for Tesla <TSLA.O> and Volkswagen <VOWG_p.DE>, said on Monday that its third-quarter operating profit likely jumped 159%, beating analysts estimates.
